doc:
A is a widget used to represent a generally complex operation splitted in several steps, guiding the user through its pages and controlling the page flow to collect the necessary data.

The design of GtkAssistant is that it controls what buttons to show and to make sensitive, based on what it knows about the page sequence and the [type][GtkAssistantPageType] of each page, in addition to state information like the page [completion][gtk-assistant-set-page-complete] and [committed][gtk-assistant-commit] status.

If you have a case that doesn’t quite fit in #GtkAssistants way of handling buttons, you can use the #GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CUSTOM page type and handle buttons yourself.

GtkAssistant as GtkBuildable

The GtkAssistant implementation of the interface exposes the @action_area as internal children with the name “action_area”.

To add pages to an assistant in , simply add it as a child to the GtkAssistant object, and set its child properties as necessary.

methods.doc: Adds a widget to the action area of a .
methods.name: add_action_widget

methods.doc: Appends a page to the assistant.
methods.name: append_page

methods.doc:
Erases the visited page history so the back button is not shown on the current page, and removes the cancel button from subsequent pages.

Use this when the information provided up to the current page is hereafter deemed permanent and cannot be modified or undone. For example, showing a progress page to track a long-running, unreversible operation after the user has clicked apply on a confirmation page.
methods.name: commit

methods.doc: Returns the page number of the current page.
methods.name: get_current_page

methods.doc: Returns the number of pages in the assistant
methods.name: get_n_pages

methods.doc: Returns the child widget contained in page number page_num.
methods.name: get_nth_page

methods.doc: Gets whether page is complete.
methods.name: get_page_complete

methods.doc: Gets the header image for page.
methods.name: get_page_header_image

methods.doc: Gets the side image for page.
methods.name: get_page_side_image

methods.doc: Gets the title for page.
methods.name: get_page_title

methods.doc: Gets the page type of page.
methods.name: get_page_type

methods.doc: Inserts a page in the assistant at a given position.
methods.name: insert_page

methods.doc:
Navigate to the next page.

It is a programming error to call this function when there is no next page.

This function is for use when creating pages of the

GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CUSTOM type.
methods.name: next_page

methods.doc: Prepends a page to the assistant.
methods.name: prepend_page

methods.doc:
Navigate to the previous visited page.

It is a programming error to call this function when no previous page is available.

This function is for use when creating pages of the

GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CUSTOM type.
methods.name: previous_page

methods.doc: Removes a widget from the action area of a .
methods.name: remove_action_widget

methods.doc: Removes the page_num’s page from assistant.
methods.name: remove_page

methods.doc:
Switches the page to page_num.

Note that this will only be necessary in custom buttons, as the assistant flow can be set with .
methods.name: set_current_page

methods.doc:
Sets the page forwarding function to be page_func.

This function will be used to determine what will be the next page when the user presses the forward button. Setting page_func to null will make the assistant to use the default forward function, which just goes to the next visible page.
methods.name: set_forward_page_func

methods.doc:
Sets whether page contents are complete.

This will make assistant update the buttons state to be able to continue the task.
methods.name: set_page_complete

methods.doc: Sets a header image for page.
methods.name: set_page_header_image

methods.doc:
Sets a side image for page.

This image used to be displayed in the side area of the assistant when page is the current page.
methods.name: set_page_side_image

methods.doc:
Sets a title for page.

The title is displayed in the header area of the assistant when page is the current page.
methods.name: set_page_title

methods.doc:
Sets the page type for page.

The page type determines the page behavior in the assistant.
methods.name: set_page_type

methods.doc:
Forces assistant to recompute the buttons state.

GTK+ automatically takes care of this in most situations, e.g. when the user goes to a different page, or when the visibility or completeness of a page changes.

One situation where it can be necessary to call this function is when changing a value on the current page affects the future page flow of the assistant.
methods.name: update_buttons_state

name: Assistant

properties.doc:
true if the assistant uses a for action buttons instead of the action-area.

For technical reasons, this property is declared as an integer property, but you should only set it to true or false.
properties.name: use-header-bar

signals.doc:
The ::apply signal is emitted when the apply button is clicked.

The default behavior of the is to switch to the page after the current page, unless the current page is the last one.

A handler for the ::apply signal should carry out the actions for which the wizard has collected data. If the action takes a long time to complete, you might consider putting a page of type .progress after the confirmation page and handle this operation within the signal of the progress page.
signals.name: apply

signals.doc: The ::cancel signal is emitted when then the cancel button is clicked.
signals.name: cancel

signals.doc: The ::close signal is emitted either when the close button of a summary page is clicked, or when the apply button in the last page in the flow (of type .confirm) is clicked.
signals.name: close

signals.doc:
The ::prepare signal is emitted when a new page is set as the assistant's current page, before making the new page visible.

A handler for this signal can do any preparations which are necessary before showing page.
signals.name: prepare
